Peoria.Shade\u2013Lohmann Bridge: The Shade–Lohmann Bridge are twin cantilever bridges that carry Interstate 474 and U.S. Route 24 over the Illinois River near the Peoria Lock and Dam located at River Mile 158.0 in Tazewell County, in the U.S. state of Illinois. It connects Bartonville and Creve Coeur. Built in 1973, the bridge was named after Pekin's former mayor and Illinois legislator Norman Shade, and Martin B. Lohmann, who served in the Illinois Legislature continuously from 1923 to 1953.
